bunpro.meaning: Even if…is the case, Supposing that
bunpro.writeup: たとえ, coming from例える, a る - Verb meaning 'to speak figuratively', is a word in Japanese that is often used with ても (or でも), in order to present possibilities. たとえ is primarily seen at the beginning of a sentence, before some kind of possibility, comparison, or supposition will be stated.たとえ tends to be used to present situations where 'even if they were true, (B) still may/may not happen'. This is called a 'contrastive' example.もしon the other hand tends to be used for examples in which (A) will directly result in (B). This is called a 'resultative' example.

examples.japanese: 空手ではたとえ試合で勝っても、ガッツポーズをしてはいけない。
examples.english: Even if you win in a karate competition, you should not celebrate visibly.

examples.japanese: たとえ暑くても、虫が入ってくるのでこの窓は開けないで下さい。
examples.english: Even if it is hot, bugs will come in, so please do not open this window.

examples.japanese: たとえ好きでも、そんなことをされたら、嫌いになる。
examples.english: Even if I like them, if someone says such a thing, I will start to dislike them.

examples.japanese: たとえ電車でも30分はかかる。
examples.english: Even by train, it will take at least 30 minutes.

examples.japanese: たとえ来年までに完成したとしても、中に入る店が決まっていないから来年中にはオープンされないだろう。
examples.english: Even if it is completed by next year, the shops that it is going in have not been decided, so it is unlikely that they will open next year.

examples.japanese: もし今年中にモールの工事が終わったら、来年の頭にはオープンするはず。
examples.english: If the construction for the mall finishes within this year, it should open at the beginning of next year.

examples.japanese: 仮令雪が降らなくても、スノーボードをしに行く。
examples.english: Even if it doesn't snow, I'm going snowboarding.

examples.japanese: 仮令彼が太っても力士にならないだろう。彼は相撲向きではないから。
examples.english: Even if he gains weight, he will never be a sumo wrestler. He's just not cut out for it.

examples.japanese: 仮令コーヒーを５杯飲んでも、眠気が取れない。
examples.english: Even if I drink 5 cups of coffee, I can't get rid of this sleepiness.

examples.japanese: 仮令あなたが行かなくても、僕は行きます。
examples.english: Even if you don't go, I will.

examples.japanese: 仮令嬉しくても、笑ってはいけない時もある。
examples.english: There are times when you cannot laugh, even if you are happy.
